issue.title: LWG 2059 added overloads that might be ill-formed for sets

discussion.p:
The restored erase(iterator) overloads introduced by LWG would be duplicates of the erase(const_iterator) ones if iterator and const_iterator are the same type, which is allowed for sets.
We should constrain them (or add prose) so that the erase(iterator) overloads are only present when the iterator types are distinct.
This applies to set, multiset, unordered_set, unordered_multiset (and flat_set and flat_muiltiset).

li.p: Modify , class template set synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: iterator erase(iterator position) requires !same_as<iterator, const_iterator>; iterator erase(const_iterator position);

li.p: Modify , class template multiset synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: iterator erase(iterator position) requires !same_as<iterator, const_iterator>; iterator erase(const_iterator position);

li.p: Modify , class template unordered_set synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: iterator erase(iterator position) requires !same_as<iterator, const_iterator>; iterator erase(const_iterator position);

li.p: Modify , class template unordered_multiset synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: iterator erase(iterator position) requires !same_as<iterator, const_iterator>; iterator erase(const_iterator position);
